alert.note: Alert for Defiance; Henry (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 01 at 11:22AM EST until March 06 at 1:00AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Indiana... Maumee River near Defiance affecting Defiance and Henry Counties. Saint Joseph River Ohio near Newville affecting Defiance, De Kalb and Allen IN Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Indiana... Tiffin River at Stryker affecting Fulton OH, Defiance and Williams Counties. North Branch Elkhart River at Cosperville affecting Noble County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Maumee River near Defiance. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flooding occurs in Kingsbury and Pontiac Parks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 10.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 AM EST Wednesday was 11.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage late Wednesday evening to 7.6 feet Friday evening. It will then rise to flood stage early Sunday morning. It will fall for the remainder of the period. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
